Plot: Manhattanite Ashley is known to many as the luckiest woman around. After a chance encounter with a down-and-out young man, however, she realizes that she's swapped her fortune for his.
Title: Just My Luck
Writer: I. Marlene King (screenplay), Amy Harris (screenplay), Jonathan Bernstein (story), Mark Blackwell (story), James Greer (story), I. Marlene King (story)
Actors: Lindsay Lohan, Chris Pine, Samaire Armstrong, Bree Turner
tomatoConsensus: Just My Luck is a screwball rom-com that fails to take advantage of Lindsay Lohan's considerable charm. The film (along with Robert Altman's A Prairie Home Companion) marks the end of Lohan's teen queen phase as she begins playing characters that are older, but not necessarily wiser. Lohan's character is supposedly cursed with bad luck, though the movie confuses misfortune with plain stupidity, leading Lohan into a long series of silly and senseless physical gags.
